Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kenfolly
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel,excellent location,the staff were exceptional very professional and helpful. The limousine service to and from the airport was first class,definitely use the concierge service they were very helpful in arranging trips. Will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Travel with toddlers”
Reviews.Author: Brwcrw
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on a 7 day trip through Italy. This hotel was in a great location and the staff was very accomodating to both children (age 20 months and 3 yrs). The doorman was delightful as was the rest of the staff for the three nights we were there. The decor is a bit formal for our taste but the staff and size of the rooms made it a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay across the road”
Reviews.Author: boltonwhiteman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok but old fashioned and tired We spent as much time as we could across the road at the via veneto grand hotel which is much nicer and 50m away If you don't often stay in 5 star hotels then this might blow you away and as a result you can get a good deal If you're used to true top hotels then this will disappoint

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Com100
Reviews.Content: Our clean room had a large bath and most of all QUIET. We were pleased with how little noise came from the street and fellow guests. The staff and hotel are small and friendly. Very attentive at breakfast and concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great position”
Reviews.Author: MaureenHerts
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days at this lovely hotel. It is in a great position where we felt very safe and is within easy walking distance of many of the sights. The Concierge was excellent at recommending restaurants, showing directions and generally being very helpful and the staff on the front desk were extremely pleasant. The breakfasts were very good with lots of choice. Our room was small (we were given the option to upgrade for a cost but refused) but the beds were comfortable and it was very quiet. The only downside was that I didn't think the AC worked well. Luckily for us, the weather was not too hot. I think it might be uncomfortable in the Summer. Contrary to some of the reviews here, the internet was charged for. I would stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Italian hotel”
Reviews.Author: pseuro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in transit for a family wedding. I travel quite a bit (and have traveled significantly in Italy) and this is one of those places that you get what you pay for in Rome. The hotel is elaborate, clean and very spacious (for European standards) and you do pay for it. The staff is helpful. Breakfast was included and nice. The food at the hotel restaurant was very good but so many places in Rome to choose from. I walked from the hotel to all major areas town and had no issue from a distance standpoint and general comfort level. It is reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Baglioni delivers its 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: MarkWilkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed 26th March for 4 nights, with buffet breakfast inc. The Baglioni sits opposite the US Embassy in the posh part of town, surrounded by other Grand 5 Star establishments, within easy reach of the main sites and a casual downhill 10 minutes walk to the Spanish steps, 15 mins to the Trevi fountain, and beyond. I had read a lot of mixed reviews about the Hotel, so reserved judgement until I had returned from my trip, and taken time to judge it for ourselves. As one might expect, 5 stars should be good, without reservation. Reception and all staff were excellent, Hotel decor fantastic, along with our Deco room, which was beautifully appointed.Complimentary water (2 small bottles) and newspaper, which was delivered am to ther room.. Breakfast was superb, 0700 till 1100 am. Hot and cold buffet, from fresh juice and fruit to Scrambled egg, sausage and bacon. You just needed to ask, and your wish was their command! Tips. Rooms on Courtyard Side and the side Street are quieter than Via Veneto (Front) Free Gym and Sauna in basement, hardly used, and an excellent cool off area. Head straight into your robe, into the lift and back to your room! Also, wi-fi is free (7 day 5 digit code) just ask at reception when checking in. I used my UK i phone to do email and surf, and fast enough. Overrall could not fault this Hotel, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kauaidudette
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel which is centrally located in downtown Rome. You can easily stroll to many of the key sights. The tour bus (on/off) is a short 10 minute walk. It is located very close to the U.S. embassy if you have business there. Staff was very helpful. Only negative is the lack of a real business center. Their computer was down the entire time of my stay. The concierge let me use his desk computer to print out boarding pass, etc but this was not really convenient if you have reasons to print other documents for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary location in a luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: RegiaAna
Reviews.Content: On Vía Venetto, a Fer blocs from the wonderful Villa Borghese park, with in walking distance to the Barberini Palazzo and the Roman National Museum, this hotel is a five star lodging with very ample rooms even for American standards.

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrible Hotel and stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Ericgrubbs
Reviews.Content: We had just left two other 5 star hotels in Italy and had great service. We expected the same from this 5 star hotel. The trip started with the hotel sending a two passenger vehicle to pick our family of six up at the airport. We had rented 3 rooms so they knew we were a large group. We had to rent taxis at our expense due to this error. Then when we arrived we found out they had us in King rooms verses the doubles we requested. The nights were terrible due to no A/C. To sleep in a 5 star with no air is not the way to spend you vacation. The food was terrible, service was terrible, hot rooms were unbearable. STAY away from this horror trap.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jason k
Reviews.Content: This *****L Hotel is amazing!!!! The service, decor, food, rooms, staff, location, EVERYTHING!!! Our room was large with a King bed and a single bed for our son with this lovely large room. Bathroom was large, clean and lead us out to our private patio. Breakfast was one of the best I have every had!! The concierge and all the staff is so helpfull. They made walking around Rome so easy. The city it self is small enough to walk around day and nite. Great location 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps, Borgeshe Park. Ten min from Trevi Fountian and from there another 5 minutes to the Patheon. Via Venito is the Rodeo Drive of Rome with all Highend Hotels. If you can afford this hotel book it and if you cant, find a way to stay there you will be very happy you did. My next trip back to Rome I am staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, perhaps best compared to limited high end hotels in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: AAH_Q
Reviews.Content: Pros 1. Large room. Large bathroom. Great value. Lovely decor. Loved the marble checkered flooring. 2. Good room service, housekeeping and friendly staff. Concigre was great. 3. Location puts you in 20 minutes walk to best sites in Rome plus the shopping. 4. Food, though expansive, was good. Con 1. Expansive internet, plus 1999-slow. 2. Wanted to extend my stay for half a day, paid off course, but was rejected and told I must leave my room in an hour. I don't believe they were 100% full. 3. As with all Italy, hotel AC did not work. Noisy street. All in all, I loved Rome and the hotel was good enough. Will stay here again and insist others do as well. Hotel, please fix your Internet and ACs.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and the location on Via Veneto was Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: Baker-Mayy
Reviews.Content: I knew going in that the Baglioni Chain is a great choice in any of the major cities in Italy... and Regina Baglioni met my expectation for Rome. I would recommend it based on the location (love Via Veneto) and for helpfulness of the staff. Almost all of the staff I encountered were hospitable and friendly. Especially the people involved with the room service.. I wish I had the name of the Girl who I met a couple of times during my stay who delivered the food, as she was extremely nice and courteous... and I would have loved to let the management know directly that they have a great asset in her. The room decor was not really my favorite as I like to get more of a traditional look when I travel to Italy and this was Black & Silver art deco... it was fine, just not my thing.. and the bathroom was good size. I was luck enough to have a small french balcony in my bedroom and bathroom.. but I do not think every room as that, Totally loved that feature though. Breakfast was above & beyond expectation.. with hot and cold options.. and some really nice looking pasteries although I never had them.. the display was very nice. Beautiful cappucinos every day.. i always looked forward to that and the waitress who delivered it was always friendly.. If there was one criticism, it was the concierge service which was really never available when I needed it.. either there was a line waiting to speak to the one gentleman at the desk or no one was at the desk.. but with that said, directions, questions, etc.. if i asked the front desk or the doorman, each was more than willing to assist so it worked out. Also, cost.. a bit high.. paying Via Veneto, 5 star hotel prices.. no bargain there... but after all is said, I was quite happy at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TRIP”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: We love traveling to Italy, and always wanted to spend a Christmas in Rome. This year we celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary. We booked this trip through American Express (Classic Vacations) Everything from start to finish was perfect. The Hotel is beautiful and in a great location. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Couldn't have asked for anything better. Would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Classy comfort and location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline S
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a 3 night stay and was not disappointed. From the start the elegant entrance and reception area, welcoming accommodating staff and spacious elegant bedroom with large marble bathroom and balcony certainly made an impression, leaving you immediately comfortable with your surroundings. The level of comfort (wonderful big bed with the best linen and pillows!) and cleanliness was first class and the full and varied breakfast of bacon and eggs, fresh fruit, fruit juices, cereals, pastries and breads, cheeses, meats etc is more than enough to set you up for the day's sightseeing. We walked from the hotel to all sights, Vatican being the farthest - 50mins to St Peter's Basilica, 1hr to the Museum entrance. The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Borghese Villa all about 10/12mins. As with all 5 star hotels the bar is expensive but the public areas are very relaxed and refined. All in all a fabulous hotel with friendly professional staff at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of its stars”
Reviews.Author: Luisp8
Reviews.Content: Just a good all-round refined hotel. Service is delivered without fuss or effort, the rooms are elegant and functional. Comfort is guaranteed. Public rooms are pleasant and breakfast is as good as it gets. As a base to see ancient Rome, the location of the hotel is good. If I want to nitpick then the only grumble is the rather small and overworked lift in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Toby W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in at Grand Executive room at this property and enjoyed every minute of it. The room was fantastic, large with great Art Deco styling and marble bathroom. The location could not be better, it was quite yet within walking distance of the shops and sights of Rome. The staff where very friendly and always remembered your name, making my stay all the more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits in a great area, close to so many areas that are easy to walk to. Subways are close by also. The staff is great. So good with kids. Marcos was one of the kindest front desk managers we have ever met. We got a beautiful upgrade to a huge suite without asking. The concierge are top notch in every way. They arranged for us a private guide to Vatican and coliseum and baby sitter for the same day and next day pronto...great service!! The tour guide was great with so much info. Rooms were lovely and had large windows. Free bar and fruit. Breakfast was included and was great although served in a dark room. Also got a free dinner with Amex reservation...The restaurant was wonderful. Excellent Rome experience. Check it out....for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A very good high quality boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OutsideNycStevie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 4 nights at this property in mid September. As it was our first time in Rome, we were wonderfully welcomed by this hotel. Although early in the day, we were graciously shown to our well appointed Art Deco room. Wow! For the next four days, we just kept saying "Wow!" Great room, perfect location, impeccable service all come at a price. For a once in a lifetime vacation, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: July W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Regina Hotel Baglioni this July with some friends back from Capri and spent there 3 nights before taking the flight to Heraklion. My friend and I stayed in a very cute room overlooking Via Veneto with nice art deco furnishing and a wonderful black marbled bathroom. I loved the so comfortable bed and the plenty of pillows they offered us. Prior to my arrival I advised the Concierge about my allergy against dust so that all curtains being in room had been removed before I arrived. I appreciated it very much and found it was a real five star customized service. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. I use not to drink milk and i'm fond of green tea and employees at restaurant remembered it since the very first time I had breakfast. I enjoyed the home made cakes offered at breakfast time and went mad for pancakes they prepare much better than I have ever had in the US! I will for sure ask them the recipe. One evening we had dinner at the Hotel restaurant called Brunello and were suggested by the Maitre Fabio for Chef's daily suggestion seafood carbonara. Simply mouthwatering! Concierge suggestions about city sightseeing were quite helpful as well and we enjoyed very much the private Vatican museum visit they arranged for us. Something really exclusive. I wish I could spend much more time at Regina and will do my best to be back with or without friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Ian O
Reviews.Content: Booked for a 2 night stay via the Amex fine hotels programme. Was delighted to find we had been upgraded to a really lovely large suite with a huge balcony from the original regular room that we had booked. The hotel food was fantastic and we were very happy from start to finish. The manager also gave my wife a really nice book as a gift which was a really nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MAK040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The room was great and had beds that were huge and extremely comfortable. The hotel is in a fantastic location for those wishing to explore the sights of Rome and we were able to walk from the hotel to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and the Colloseum as all were only a short distance away. we chose not to use the hotel restaurant as we found that the prices were ridiculously expensive as was room service which had a charge of 8 euros per person on top of the cost of anything ordered! Also, room tax was 6 euros per night for the room and the hotel also has a charity which is charged at 1 euro per night - not much, but all these "little extras" all add up! the staff could not have been more helpful and the chamber maids were always very friendly and the hotel was immaculate. If we were to return to Rome again we would definately consider staying there again although there were some equally great looking hotels along the same street. Would definately recommend to friends an family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, just the right size.”
Reviews.Author: Antonio D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for a business overnight. Since the last time I stayed, the hotel has undergone major refurbishmnet and is shining and in tiptop shape. The hotel rooms are very comfortable, spacious and offer a refurbished style with a deco touch. The location is ideal for Rome, right on the Via Veneto and within 5 minutes walking distance from the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti, Trevi fountain and main attractions. The size of the hotel is not too large and yet not too small, so you can feel the personalized service. Definitely a place to choose on the next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service”
Reviews.Author: endorfun
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Regina (2 Adults + 1 teenager). Found the hotel to be very nice. Recieved an upgrade upon arrival which turned out to be wonderful. The staff was excellent. Concierge could not be more helpful. Dinner in hotel restuarant was excellent as well. Did not take advantage of spa facilities so cannot comment on them. All in all, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: z3phyrr
Reviews.Content: The service was really good, the breakfast was great - though repetitious. I stayed there for 9 nights and menu was the same. But still, great food and service. I loved the location, a few meters from Hard Rock Cafe, 300 meters to the nearest Metro, walking distance (1km?) to the Spanish Steps, 20 minutes walk to Fontana di Trevi. My daughter (12yrs) and me even walked to the Colosseum from the Hotel. The room is plush and spacious. Tv channels are abundant, with English news channels, others are in Italian though. However, the internet is not free - 14euros per day! All in all, I would stay here again and recommend to travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinLena
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in various hotels In Rome I found this hotel to be very good value for money. Although under most country standards this would be more a 4 stars hotel than 5, it is a nice clean hotel in a great location. The rooms are nice and clean an average size. They are well laid out and the bed is really comfortable. The bathroom is a little cramped but it has everything you need. The decoration is old fashion but Very well kept so I found it charming - like you are staying in am old palace. The breakfast was very good - lots of lovely pastries, cakes and bread alon with cold meats, fruit, juices, etc... My only complain is that the wifi signal is extremely poor. The only place I could get signal was te bathroom. When I mention this in reception they said they couldn't so nothing and that was it... Despite I mentioned this as a requirement in my booking. Overall I would stay back in this hotel because the location is great and it is nice and clean and it is good value compared to other hotels around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: sixpalz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our Tauck tour of Italy. Our room was large and well appointed. The staff was very friendly and helpful, including pressing our clothes for dinner with very short notice. The breakfast buffet had a large selection to choose from and the food was very fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and over rated,!!!”
Reviews.Author: Orangejelly
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked this hotel for a 3 day break for our 25th wedding anniversary. He explained it was a special occassion when booking, however when we arrived the room wasnt what we expected. It was not the room we thought we had booked, it consisted of two single beds pushed together and made up as singles with a double throw over, ever so romantic hey !!!! We did not notice this till late evening, therefore did not report the fact till the next morning, after my husband had rolled over in the night and ended up on the floor as the beds had slid apart on the marble floor !!!! They rectified the problem by making the two singles up as one bed, not the most comfortable nights sleep, put a damper on the romance side of things and Rome is meant to be one of the most romantic places to visit !!!! Room was clean though and they were thoughtful enough to leave us complimentary bottles of sparkling water, yes water a nice way of toasting our special 25th anniversary. I personally felt it was over priced, for 3 days bed and breakfast it cost just short of £1,500, I have since found out I could of had a 10 day Rome / Sorrento package for the same price. On a positive note the american style buffet breakfast was fantastic, so glad it came with the room as I would not have paid 33 euros per person. Hope to visit Rome again soon but sorry will not be staying at the Hotel Regina Baglioni.

Reviews.Title: “Great in Some Ways, Not So Much in Others”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover23456
Reviews.Content: The Positives: (1) Our Junior Suite was spacious, modern and gorgeously appointed. (2) Some hotel staff was exceptionally gracious and helpful. The Negatives: (1) Baglioni is the only AmEx Fine Hotels & Resorts property at which I've stayed that did not have an upgrade available for the entirety of our stay. Thus we had to change rooms mid-stay, and got the upgraded Jr Suite for only 3 of 5 nights. (2) During our first day in the Jr Suite, a badly leaking showerhead sprayed water all over the bathroom, and the mini-fridge didn't work -- both necessitating repairs. (3) I asked the Concierge to make dinner reservations at specific restaurants for each of our 5 nights in Rome, but he failed to make any of them. We were able to dine at each of our chosen restaurants, but had a lengthy wait in 2 and were assigned a crap table in 2 others (because they squeezed us in). (4) The hotel restaurant (Brunello) was awful. Although it was nearly empty, we were relegated to a lesser table because most tables were purportedly reserved; but over 2 hours later, the restaurant remained nearly empty. Further, the somalier served us an overpriced bottle of Prosecco, the beef special (about $55 US) -- the waitress's strongest recommendation -- was horribly tough and flavorless, and the seabass was bland. Of the 20 dinners we had on our vacation, dinner at the hotel's restaurant was one of the more expensive but easily the worst. (5) Baglioni's neighborhood is attractive, but not terribly convenient with respect to the principal tourist sites. (6) Although Baligioni offered free wifi internet access, the signal was so weak in our Jr Suite as to render that perk almost meaningless.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Embargado
Reviews.Content: Had two rooms in June 2011. Rooms were a bit quirky but functional. Service was very good as was the location. Staff was courteous and helpful. Breakfast buffet was good - - met the standards you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Beds were hard, but still was able to enjoy a decent night's sleep

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: WillTravelMoreOneDay
Reviews.Content: For a 5 Star Luxury Hotel, it didn't seem above average at all. My husband and I finished our honeymoon in Rome. After coming from another 5 Star luxury hotel in a different city, Hotel Regina Baglioni was a sad comparison. First, the room we got was pretty small with no real perks. The hotel staff, though friendly, was not very helpful. Our package included 3 dinners at various restaurants. They failed to give us cards that we needed for the restaurants. Also, the restaurants that came in the package were awful. Big tourist traps. You know it's bad when you look around and all you see are tourists coming from their hotels. My husband and I wanted to skip the meals, but the honeymoon package was a wedding gift so we spent 3 nights in rome with 3 bad meals! Not going to lie, the restaurants that they include in the package are very fancy, but my husband and I were looking for authentic family owned restaurants. We found the best family owned restaurants in Amalfi that tasted a million times better at a quarter of the cost of the restaurants the hotel put us up in Rome. The worse was the restaurant in the hotel- do not go there if you are looking for Italian food. Overall I felt like this restaurant was just trying to find ways to make money off of you. First they charge for the internet. When they try to help you 'plan' activities around Rome, they prefer to push you in the more expensive route. I definitely would not stay here again. P.S. Also showed up at 4 pm the day of check in and the room wasn't ready. So late.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl1429
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Honeymoon staying at the Regina Baglioni. The hotel is beautiful, marble stairway, stylish velvet and paintings galore. All staff were prestine, curtious and willingly attended to our requests. We were fortunate to receive a room up-grade (which had been re-decorated within the year), wine and fruit for our Honeymoon. Our room was at the back of the hotel so quiet and peaceful. Attention to detail on complimentary items robes/slippers/toiletries were all embossed with Regina Baglioni so a nice touch. Weather up-dates with a chocolate left in your room for your return. Breakfast was self service cereals, fruits, sausage and egg, danish pastries, meats and cheese with teas etc waitered in silver pots, or room service if desired. Although we didnt spend an evening in the Restaurant, the photos looked very impressive.The location is perfect for quality shopping and dining, in walking distance of Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain and to buses for open top touring. From this location in 3 days we managed to visit the the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain/Pantheon/Colosseum and 3D cinema viewing)Piazza Navona/The Vatican (inside), more shops than you can dream off. We did this on our own as on the guided tours the visitors were walking by everything, with good understanding but missing out on the hidden gems of The Eternal City. Rome is a grand place and the The Regina Baglioni is in the heart of it. Highly recommend, with thanks. M and S.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Beware concierge”
Reviews.Author: ultimatevaluetravel
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was decent. Location is great. Breakfast very plentiful and good choices Beware of concierge services. They did not make dinner reservations that were requested and did steer us to overpriced tourist traps for meals. They also tried to overcharge us for transportation to the airport. On the drive to the airport they tried to charge us 20 euro more than we paid on the way in. Wifi was advertised as included but we were charged. They even charged for wifi in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “OK customer service,No sleep”
Reviews.Author: hunna01
Reviews.Content: We got a room at this hotel through a friend for a "steal" $245 a night instead of $500. I was really excited as this was a special treat for our 20th anniversary. I'll break it down for you."Do not disturb signs" are like guide lines, staff always came in the room at least twice a day regardless if the sign was out ! Once we were making love! We never had a good nights sleep as garbage,recycling and deliveries were made through out the night from midnight to 5 am! We complained and they didn't have another room to move us to.Nor did they ask after if we had a better nights sleep. Free Wi-fi listed on their website is now $8 Euros an HOUR! Breakfast included NOPE starting at $16 Euro(coffee,juice and a bun!) Would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone look else where!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: StorytellerBill
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I was in Rome for four nights for work and stayed at the Hotel Regina Baglioni because that's where my client's meetings were. I'm glad they were. It is an exquisite property, made even more so by the incredibly gracious and intuitive staff. There's an old-world elegance to this property as well the service, but it doesn't feel at all stuffy or too formal. You welcomed like an old friend every time you walk in the door. My room was one of the smaller ones and faced the interior of the hotel instead of the street, but it was still incredibly comfortable with a gorgeous bathroom and one of the best showers I've ever had the pleasure of enjoying. It was also nice and quiet. The rooms are spotlessly clean, and the bed linens are sublime. The food is "to die for", and the breakfast buffet is, in my mind, actually worth the 32 Euro cost. You cannot beat the location on the beautiful Via Veneto and right down the street from the gorgeous Parc Villa Borghese. It was a great place to have a meeting in, with the large, well lit meeting room at the top of the hotel, offering the best views of the city (see photo). To be honest, I have no idea what the hotel costs per night. I imagine, it's a pretty penny. Still, I would recommend at least investigating it if you're heading to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: iluvtravel_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel week from 4/1-4/3 2011. The staff was very nice, except that the concierge insisted on sending us to tourist traps but we knew better and just found our way to other places that were off the beaten path. The room's decor was out dated and needs changing, but that is about the worst thing I could say about this place (and I am picky!). The bed was a bit hard but I think that is common in Italy in general. We had turn down service every night which was nice after a long day of walking around. We were lucky that our breakfast was included in our package because the last thing you want to do in Rome is hunt down for a place to eat early in the morning. The American breakfast at the Baglioni was very good. Location: is right accross from the Westin on via venetto and accross from US embassy.. It is not to far from Metro or the Trevi fountain or Spanish steps. its a nice area. No complaints of the Regina. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScaccoMatto74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in the heart of Rome. Rooms are clean and well furnished. Service is excellent. Good breakfast. Free wifi connection. Overall a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roman escapade”
Reviews.Author: Divaspy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, the bar is wonderful and service is just outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Not impressed"”
Reviews.Author: OfficeatTheClarence
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with the Regina Baglioni. We booked this holiday through British Airways who usually recommend reasonable hotels. Big mistake with this one and not cheap either. The hotel is not shy charging top dollar for shabby rooms. Room 709 decor very dated, room shabby, grout in bathroom needs replacing, carpet needs replacing, furniture needs replacing. Thick dust covered the vent in the bathroom and in the morning the sewerage smell from the bathroom was overpowering. I don't believe in moaning after I have stayed at a hotel as I am a hotelier myself. If a customer has a geniuine complaint then this should be addressed whilst you are on the premises so that you can try and come to some arrangement to resolve the problem. I went straight to reception after I checked into Room 709 to tell them that I was not pleased with the room that had been allocated. It was dark, very dated bedspread and a carpet your granny would have had in the 40's there was also a loud air conditioning noise outside the window and a brick wall for a view. I was told that it was very busy and the only room that was available was a grande deluxe room which was going to be an extra 250 euros per night this was at a discounted rate as it was selling at 600 euros per night that particular day. Daylight robbery! I was shown this room which I wouldn't have paid an extra 50 euros. We were told that we could move to another room same category that we were in on the Tuesday. We declined that offer as there was no point, all the rooms looked the same except for the colour scheme. The safety deposit box in the room was also broken. The concierge recommended a restaurant for us on the Tuesday and my husband got food posioning so he ended up having to spend Wednesday in bed. I asked at breakfast if I could take a cup of tea to my husband who was sick in bed and they did this straight away at a cost of 15 euros for 1 cup. Make sure that you iron all your clothes before you leave home as they do not have any iron or iron boards for health and safety reasons. However, a maid would come and do it for me. I asked would there be a charge and never got an answer so I decided to wear creased clothes because if a cup of tea cost 15 euros what was I going to be charged for ironing? If you are really concerned about health and safety then why was it possible for me to plug my hair straightners into thye socket in the bathroom? I think that this is just another money making excuse. Breakfast was ok. Anyway my advice is to stay clear of Regina Baglioni as they are trading on their name only. I would really like to know how you were rated 5 star as I have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world and have never encountered rooms like yours. Advice to the manager and front of house. If guests are unhappy with the room that they are allocated for good reasons then I would suggest that instead of trying to make more money from them to actually do what you should have been doing in the first place by offering 5 star accommodation, not 3 star. Invest some money otherwise the new hotel next door might just pick up some of your business. Sorry that it has been a negative review but please, please don't waste your money staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing 5-star about this place.”
Reviews.Author: MM206
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on the location and relatively lower price for a "5 star" hotel. When we got to our room, there was a potent odor that was so vile, I walked right out and back to the front desk. The man at the desk said he would send somebody. We went back the room and waited...and waited....and waited. It was getting close to our dinner reservation, so I went in to take a shower only to discover black mold all over the vents and shower. I immediately walked out and called the front desk- now irate- the man on the phone said that this was 'not possible because baglioni is a 5 star hotel.'. By what standard, I have no idea. Finally someone came to the room. He had the audacity to tell me he did not smell or see anything. Oh, and the only other available room in the hotel was a suite that costs 4 times what we had paid. Finally, I made enough of a fuss (and threatened to leave for a room at the Eden, a real 5 star hotel down the block), that a room magically appeared. Though it was smaller than what we paid for, there was no toxic black mold. Overall a horrific experience and a poor excuse for "5 star." There are many amazing places to stay in Rome, don't make the same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fatimads
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. Fro The moment you walk in you are made welcome by their staff. Rooms are well decorated in 5 star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SideSlip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here four times in consecutive weeks on short business trips, and belong to an organisation that is a corporate customer of this hotel (and therefore might expect good treatment). This was not to be. The first two times were okay (how wrong can things go if you check in at 1 am and check out at 7.30?) But the next two were absolutely appalling; primarily the service, the sheer variability of the rooms on offer, and the mad pricing. On service - completely echo other travellers sentiments here - the staff are unfailingly unhelpful - often with a polite smile but a spectacularly useless attitude to actually helping. Basically, for a 5 star hotel, this outfit could not A) provide me with a plug adapter for UK to European plugs B) could not direct me to a shop to buy cigarettes c) could not change money from GBP to Euro D) could not get me a couple of fried eggs for breakfast in under 30 minutes On rooms - I have stayed in rooms in this hotel ranging from grand art deco suites to pokey holes described in reviews under average or terrible (and am writing from the latter right now). -- There is no guarantee you will get a decent room. T - The room climate control does not work - I was freezing the last time I was here, saw the temperature control showing 23 degrees, felt it was nowhere near 23 degrees (much colder) called reception saying - cant get the room to warm up - can you help. Reception basically said "my computer says its 23 degrees so cant help you" WOW ! - If you're a business traveller and intend to work in your room - forget it. The desk (if there is one in the room - the pokey ones dont have any) does not have any power plug connectors ! So you have to unplug the table lamp to get your laptop or phone charger connected ! Even in the grand suites ! If you're in a pokey one - like room 226 (writing from there now) there is no desk ! How can you have a business hotel room in a 5 star hotel in a major European city without a desk? Even an Ibis or a HolidayInn would have a desk ! On pricing - this is nuts. I have paid Eur 170 a night (which is my corporate rate) but I have also been the victim of highway robbery last week - asked to pay Eur 536 for a night + VAT ! Ostensibly because it was Fashion Week. However, the Majestic, down the road from this hotel - and way way better by the way - did not differentiate their rates ! I asked for a thermos of coffee in my room - Eur 20 + service charge for basicaly espresso + hot water ! Summary to business travellers - avoid like the plague. You may have a good experience, you may have a poor one - and there is no way to know in advance. I have learnt my lesson and am spending my last night here, ever. And going back to my company travel guys to have a heart to heart on how we choose preferred hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “lovely comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shadowjaz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Italy that started at the Regina Baglioni. Very comfortable large room. They upgraded us to a Jr. suite. The staff were all really nice and helpful. I thought the room decoration was very nice; the style was art deco. Large bathroom with double sink. The breakfast was very good, varied selection with fabulous croissants and pastries. (They do need to learn how to make scrambled eggs-way too runny) Loved the location. We walked to the Spanish steps and to shopping. The only complaint was that they charged us 8 Euros for ice. Turns out the charge was a service charge for room service. Live and learn. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again.”
Reviews.Author: DubaiTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Regina Baglioni for 5 nights in a classic room on our honeymoon trip to Italy. While the hotel gives you a good impression when you first step in, the rooms and service did not leave that mark on us to ever return to this hotel. Rooms are tired, in that they would have been glamorous when the hotel opened, but the fittings are wearing out, like the bathroom taps, door handles, etc. Doesn't stand out as luxury, in my opinion. And the service, while i would give it to the staff for their courtesy, in a hotel as big as this, i dont expect concierge to be charging us a commission on taxi booking or fixing up tours (it didnt happen at the other 5 stars in venice or florence atleast). We booked a Vatican tour via the concierge desk and we were told at the tour office that they would charge us and then pay commission to our hotel (in the course of a conversation). The location is decent, with a 15 min walk to Trevi/Spanish steps. Train station is about 15 euros in a cab. Oh and a tip for those of you visiting there, there is a internet shop down the road which offers a much cheaper option than using the hotel's business center! But I'd probably try another hotel in my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel, how can you go wrong”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Lovely 5 star hotel. Excellent location -- Great bed, bathroom, bathtub, huge closet. The service was wonderful. Staff were helpful. Only downsides were outside noise (but it is a big city) and the AC didn't cool that good. But I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost absolute marble!”
Reviews.Author: asb5522
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel this early May for three nights. The superior room interior was superb, and had a big bathroom with a bide. Hotel person came to my room every night at around 9 P.M. to hand to me tomorrows events, news and local weather forecast on a piece of paper. The hotel room is equipped with a good security safe, enough bed space, and most ravishingly solid patterned marble floor! However, the elevator was (singular) quite small. Concierge helped me quite efficiently and could speak at least two different languages including Danish, and French. Restaurant staffs did not speak English much but they were well-trained, and all food selection was absolutely fine, particularly the morning coffee served with warm milk. The hotel location is also unspeakable. Situated near Galleria Borghese and only 20 minutes walk to anywhere. The opposite building is American Embassy, which should be important for some people. In the night, be careful, there are many night club staffs who would try to drag you inside. Overall Baglioni Rome is worthy to pay 300 Euros per night and I am unanimous in that.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: jpizitz
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Regina Baglioni with extended family of nine. Excellnet experience. Hotel is elegant and tasteful. Our rooms delightful and comfortable. Staff pleasant and helpful. Concierge outstanding. All minor issues we had with the rooms were attended to immediately. Had one issue with a dinner reservation - not the hotel's fault - and they were all over it trying to 'fix' it. I do agree that it's a bit pricey. I liked the location on the Via Veneto, and actually enjoyed the walking for shopping and sightseeing. Getting around Rome from this location is pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, though a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Pixie1979
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, I can say pretty much everything was perfect. The only downsides are: 1. It's a bit far from the main attractions of the city - about a 15 minute walk. In a way, this is a good thing, because you're far from the tourist crowds and noise of Rome, but if you intend to spend all your time wandering around Rome, the walk to and from the hotel will be a bit tiring and taxis are not cheap in Rome. 2. We thought the hotel was a bit overpriced. After all, despite all the good qualities, this is a city hotel that doesn't even have a view, not a tropical resort.

Reviews.Title: “5* pricing for a not so 5* room & service”
Reviews.Author: HarryBeagle
Reviews.Content: Upon first entering the hotel I was impressed - just what you would expecta fancy hotel in Rome to look like, Attractive, opulent and spacious reception area, staircase and breakfast room. The cost of the room was expensive and so I expected to be shown to an attractive and luxurious bedroom. This was the biggest let down. The room was small and tired and the bathroom needed fe-furbing or at the very least re-grouting!! I have stayed at many luxury hotels in my time and this could not even begin to compete in the bedroom stakes. The hotel restaurant lacks atmosphere - in fact my husband and I felt as if we had walked into a library as we were served by our moody head waiter and observed the lack of enthusiasm of fellow diners. The food is very expensive and thus I expected very good food. The food was decent but not at all good enough to warrant a 5* price tag. In fact my starter was ridiculously salty and I sent it back. I did not get a replacement starter and at the end of our dinner my starter had been charged and they decided not to charge me for my dessert which was 10 Euro's cheaper! I was really not at all impressed! Finally the moody receptionist did little to raise expectations at the start of our trip or at the end for that matter. Only Francesco, the delightful concierge, carried out his job with courtesy, professionalism and great spirit!

Reviews.Title: “Absouloutly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolTraveller
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed for 4 nights at his hotel and what a truly unforgetable experience. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, they upgraded our room. We then came back on the first day to find complimentary bubbly and canapes. As we were to tired to partake of this they brought it back chilled the second night with fresh strawberries . We said we both felt like royalty. The concierge and the staff in reception were really helpful and could not do enougt to ensure your time with them was a wonderful experience. A beutiful art deco room, completly refurbished with a view onto the Via Veneto We only had breakfast in the hotel and this was excellent. We will definately if back in room stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “deluxe rooms with auful view”
Reviews.Author: Alpel
Reviews.Content: We had booked one superior and one deluxe room to Aleph Boscolo Hotel. Due to an undefined problem this hotel relocated us to Regina Baglioni. The superior room allocated to our children was small and stinging cigarette. Our "deluxe" room (no 116) was on the first floor, on the back side of the hotel, facing the red "roman dome" you can see on the photo attached hereto. The whole machinery of the hotel was ending just out of our window and the noise was permanent. We immediately asked for another room. Initially they informed us that the only room available was the "Penthouse suite" with an extra charge of 350 € per night. We refused and they finally discovered a superior room available for the night. They told us that if we liked it we could keep it for the rest of our stay and since it was of a lower category the price would be adjusted. This superior room was descent and significantly larger than this of our kids. Both rooms were noisy. When checking out we asked to be charged for the 2 superior rooms we had occupied but the reception and the manager of duty refused because we had refused the so called deluxe room they had made available to us. You may judge if the red roman dome and the modern roman aqueducts (or aeroducts) just in front of the window of room 116 are of a deluxe level. Apart this the hotel is a pretentious, lux but dull hotel, expensive for what it offers

Reviews.Title: “Dated ,expensive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: doctorrod
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short stay at the Regina Baglioni. Lets go to the positives first: very good location on the famous Via Venetto, nice hotel lobby, good concierge service. Now to the negatives ; this hotel looks dated , rooms need refurbishing,rooms are very small and general service is questionable.We informed on arrival that the safe in our room was not working. Four days later, it still was not working. We loved Rome and probably be back some day but not to this hotel. The quality/price ratio is definitely not there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jstick
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel and the staff is great. The location is a bit out of the way but Rome is very spread out so there are few hotels that are convenient to every place you want to visit. We had two rooms next to each other. My only complaint is that the room for my kids was very warm (room 201). The first night my kids slept with the window open. that solved the problem. However, there was a tree outside that window which attracts flies and my son woke up with many bites. the following two nights the staff relocated my kids to another room on the second floor. They could not have been nicer or more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Private rooftop jacuzzi under the stars overlooking Rome,Romance Moi?”
Reviews.Author: scrumptiousbumus
Reviews.Content: What do you get the guy that has everything? When I met him indoors I had a background in travel and Trainee Lawyer and he was a Champagne Charlie ski bum Estate Agency chain owner. So I found this boutique hotel with suites that had rooftop garden terraces with huge private jacuzzis that cost £3000 for 2 nights back in Dec 05. In my dreams. So I booked a regular room with discount from my friends at GTA Hotels and gave him the trip as a surprise. On arrival they upgraded us to THE Suite. Yes the one with rooftop Jaccuzzi under the stars. The bed was huge. The biggest I've ever stayed in tho the hotel pics and write up suggest they've since refurbished and the beds appear smaller. The matching trendy glass his and hers sinks were marvelous if messy (water and glass don't stay sparkling for long) a tropical power shower and jacuzzi bath indoors as well. While he played in the indoor tub and caused the bathroom to flood with bubbles from the jacuzzi tub he told me to call room service and ask for a bottle of champagne. They took so long I rang down to see if they were squashing the grapes. No Madam they politely replied. When they arrived there were 2 guys pushing a trolley laden with bowls of fruit and hot melted chocolate and the Champagne. Ah thinks me. That's what took the time. When I called down they asked me what Champagne I wanted. Not being a Champagne drinker I hesitated and they suggested some Krug? Krug any good darling I shouted to him now drowning under bubbles. Yes that's ok he replied. When the waiter handed me the chit I gulped signed and kept my British reserve. Honey I waiveringly shouted after they'd gone, they charged me 350 euros which was more than I paid for the room for 2 nights. Not being one to waste a 350 euro bottle of champagne he proposed to me in the rooftop jacuzzi that night under the starry night skies of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel for the value in Italy and the service is Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: DRAMMS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice (marble floors, large rooms, large bathroom). It was clean. The service was incredible. The first night, they left fresh fruit in our room with some small flowers. They changed towels twice a day for us (without asking). For the price $180 - it was a great deal. It was larger than most European rooms. The staff was very friendly. It is within walking distance to the Trevi fountain and around the corner is a great little restaurant called Aurora 10 who specializes in fresh grilled fish.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cupcake135
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, the rooms very nice. The best part about this hotel was the concierge(s) - every one of them was so helpful - and we had a lot of requests. They managed to negotiate a refund with a touring company after a bad experience and also located a restaurant that was serving the super delicious burrata cheese. The location was in a nice area but being at the top of the Via Veneto, I got tired of having to walk up and down the Spanish Steps every time we went somewhere! There are worse things I suppose, and that certainly wouldn't dissuade me from returning. We had a massage included in our package - a so-so experience. Our breakfasts were also included, no complaints there. We had drinks in the bar one afternoon and were served many delicious snacks to go with them. Overall, a lovely hotel. Side note tip: get a private guide to tour the Vatican. Its so worth it to have a knowledgable guide - truly made it an unforgettable experience and my favorite excursion of our 10 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Business--Good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: JMLondonNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regina Baglioni last month for a business trip, and had a very positive experience. My room was small (as most European hotels are), but perfect as I was by myself and working. The staff were lovely, the gentleman at the front desk said my room wasn't ready when I arrived, and asked if I could wait a bit and he would give me and upgrade. I didn't mind at all, as I had only travelled from London and was happy to go out and have lunch. It was incredibly hot in Rome during my stay, and the air conditioning in my room was perfect. I needed a cable as my PC does not have wireless, and they brought it immediately. The bathroom was gigantic, with lovely marble and fixtures. The bed was very comfortable, and there was ample closet space. I'm not sure I'd recommend the hotel for a romantic getaway, as the rooms are somewhat "corporate" in feel, but the location is fabulous so if you don't mind the somewhat bland feeling of the room and want all of the conveniences of a four-star hotel, you'd probably enjoy it. Breakfast was lovely, good service and great buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Romance....”
Reviews.Author: Nuala67
Reviews.Content: Beauiful, Romantic & Elegant...What a wonderful honeymoon experience in such a fabulous city. This is hotel is set in such a beautiful location and just a short walk from the Spanish Steps. We had a delicious contentintal breakfast set in their beautiful modern art-deco breakfast room. On our final nite we had the most fabulous meal in their restaurant. Our room was a suite which was so spacious and comfortable. Cant wait to return to the regina baglioni some day soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at an Excellent First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewJersey007
Reviews.Content: The Personal and Hotel Staff were cordial and accommodating – The Service was First Class Location of The Hotel was Excellent --- Directly across from the US Embassy – Central Location of Rome -- Great Surroundings Highly Recomennded

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: JessykaNYC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay here during a three week stay in Italy to meet extended family. At first we were attracted to the grandeur of the street but the hotel failed to "wow" us. Perhaps thats the jaded New Yorkers speaking but the stay was nice and we did enjoy the room and the bathrooms were gorgeous. The location was not exactly central to Rome's popular attractions but we were close to the Spanish steps and an awesome shopping area that mirrors 57th and 5th in NYC. The smaller restaurants were often the better ones (often located on small streets off Via Venuto sp?) Overall a nice experience. The staff was often a little cool but we didnt let that dampen our trip. I recommend this hotel if you want a nice place and you are somewhat familiar with the city already.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pk78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina Baglioni hotel for our 6 day honeymoon in Rome. Overall, we have been quite satisfied with the room and the hotel in general. The staff was very friendly and almost always smiling. We had booked a grand deluxe room through a website (booking.com) and asked for a room with a view to the streets (and not the inner courtyard) and a double bed. The hotel mailed us, back assuring us that both requests would be met and that upon arrival a bottle of spumante (sort of champagne) would be waiting in our room. Indeed, our room was facing the street to the side of the hotel and equipped with a double bed. No spumante was in the room however, so I asked the person at the reception who said that the maids would probably place it at their 6pm visit to clean the room. Indeed, when we got back later that night the bottle was there. Sadly, even though the bed looked like a double one, when we laid down that night I found out that it was formed of 2 single mattresses placed side-by-side. Our room was no. 211, indeed a grand deluxe room identical to the one shown at the hotels' website (the red one). I am pretty sure that the room shown in that picture is the one we stayed at. My first impression of the room was partly negative: I expected it to be a bit bigger and certainly quite brighter, but I have to admit that I was comparing it to the suite we stayed at back in Greece after our wedding (for one night) which was fabulous, brightly lit and full of windows. Our room at Regina, like all rooms in Rome (I assume), had only one (relatively narrow, yet tall) window, therefore little light was entering the room. But do not expect something different since all buildings in the centre of Rome have small windows because of the old-style architecture. The room was a bit dark, but quite aristocratic and classy; marble floor, marble bathroom with 2 sinks, good quality polished wood and leather chairs, Murano glass lights (and a big chandelier), minibar, safe, TV and a desk. Everything in the room was good quality and overall we felt as we were living in a quite luxurious environment. I would prefer it, however, that we were given the other type of deluxe room since judging from the photos at the website it looked quite brighter. On the second day, I asked for a brighter room with one single mattress, but we were told that there was no other room vacant and that they found it weird since our room was recently renovated and most people prefer it. I guess it must have been one of the hotel's best rooms. Since I was not too happy with our room, we went to see two other hotels in the area (not on Via Veneto but close to it). We asked to see a deluxe room in both hotels. The first one (Eden) was quite lighter and felt more "happy". For a moment I was ready to book it for the rest of our stay in Rome. The room at the other hotel (Splendide Royale) gave me a good first impression, but it seemed kind of "fake" and using medium quality materials (e.g. the wood looked quite cheap). When we returned to our room, comparing it to the other two rooms we saw in the other hotels, I started to appreciate it more. It was a lot classier than the others and quite better quality. Even though the Eden was brighter and happier, our room was much more aristocratic; it looked more like a luxurious room in a palace, than a lux room in a hotel. The Eden was a lux room in a hotel (moquette floor). So we decided to stay at the Regina Baglioni and I became more and more happy with it. We had a good time and had no problems with the room or the hotel (besides the mattress). It is worthy to mention that the room was cleaned up twice; once in the morning, and a second time around 6pm in the afternoon, where they also left close to our pillows a weather forecast for the next day and a small (bitter) chocolate for each one of us. Nice. The hotel is very close to the Spanish steps, about 10 minutes or so and it is within walking distance to the whole historical center of Rome, if you like walking! At first we thought that we'd have to use the bus or metro, but Rome is a lovely city to walk and we often walked from the Hotel to Piazza Navona, or from Campo Di Fiori to the hotel at night. If you don't want to walk, the metro station is 2 minutes from the hotel, and the bus stop to go to the center is 3 minutes (on Via Tritone, route 62). The location of the hotel was brilliant; Via Veneto must be the nicest street in the whole Rome! A classy area of Rome with restaurants and stores, tall green trees, little traffic and lovely "atmosphere". Hard Rock Cafe is on the next block to the hotel. The hotel was not too big. Upon entering, do not expect a huge lobby or the wow-factor. It is aristocratic yet kind of small. A lobby can be found if you walk further inside, an oval room with no windows (I think). The restaurant-bar is named "Brunello" and can be accessed either from inside the hotel or from the street. It's nicely (in a modern way) decorated and the food is good, yet quite expensive. Our room didn't include breakfast and we opted not to pay for it since it's quite pricey for a buffet breakfast. Overall our stay at the Regina Baglioni was quite good. Had it been for a real double bed and a brighter room, I would dare to rate it "excellent". Keep in mind though that my review is based on the Grand Deluxe room that we stayed at - I did not have the chance to see how the standard room was.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLover72
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this great hotel. Room was large & beautiful, on a high floor with a view of the American Embassy and the staff could not have been more charming. We walked in on a whim and after my husband negotiated around 100 Euro off the rate (he speaks Italian and more importantly, is on the 'Italian Wavelength' ) we decided to stay for the whole five nights. Decor is pretty formal, but we like that. Very surprised to read some of the negative comments - perhaps the hotel management has also read them and made the appropriate changes. I would highly recommend this hotel. As with any hotel don't take the first room or the first rate offered, especially in the 'off' season.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: LoiLau
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Baglioni for the first part of our honeymoon and we had splashed out on this one. What a disappointment. The staff were incredibly rude, most probably used to dealing with business customers and guests who are rude to them. The first room we were offered smelt stale and was a bit dingy. It's ensuite had no extractor, so filled with steam within minutes of putting the shower on and the shower leaked. Plucking up the courage to complain, I did so. At reception I said I was not happy with my room - to be met with a cold response. After stamping my feet, they reluctantly showed me another room - with twin beds! In the capital of love, it took ten minutes of arguing that I was on my honeymoon and would not be sleeping in separate beds before I finally got shown an acceptable room. This was too much hassle for only three nights. For the remainder of the stay, we did not spend much time in the hotel, avoiding the frosty doormen and desk attendants. We did not eat there either - this too looked unwelcoming. We were glad to see the back of the Baglioni. If we visit Rome again, we think we will try a 3*/4* which might offer a slightly friendlier service.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomj675
Reviews.Content: This is a very luxurious elegant hotel. However its almost too stuffy. You don't get a warm feeling from the staff and during breakfast which was excellent (except for the bacon) you almost feel you have to whisper. Although they will do anything you ask (from freshly cooked eggs to crisping up the bacon) they are so formal that you are almost afraid to ask. Our room was elegant although a bit small for 3 people, the bathroom was beautiful although you couldn't open the door all the way because of the bidet.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the other weekend and had a really lovely time. To be honest I normally go for more modern hotels (like the 'design hotels' group) but I really liked the big drapes and marble floors. I wouldn't have it in my living room, but it was really luxurious & decadent for a weekend away. Having read the reviews I was a little worried that when we were lead to the end of the corridor and down some stairs that we'd end up in an old room with broken air con, but the room had just been renovated and the aircon worked as it should. There was no bath but there was a huge swanky shower. Toilettries had a nice scent. Mini bar was full. Breakfast buffet had everything you might want. We found the staff chatty and helpful. The most dissapointing thing was that the website says there is a roof terrace, but there isn't. But we went round to the hotel Eden for that instead (lovely view at dusk). I guess even a 5 star hotel is what you make of it, but I thought this one had character. Well, we had fun anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “La Crappola Vita - would you pay EUR400 for this?”
Reviews.Author: mrmattyham
Reviews.Content: From the word go, we knew it wasn't going to be all roses at the Regina Baglioni. What set this hotel apart was no welcome, not even a smile, followed by an aloof receptionist who looked at us upon check-in as if to say "What are you doing here?". He then begrudingly showed us to our room, only to discover that the window was broken, allowing no natural light or fresh air. When we brought this to the hotel's attention, to their credit, they promptly moved us next door to a room that was satisfactory and the room type which we paid for. At breakfast we were met by even ruder staff and it felt like the we were in the room of the living dead! Even the interior furnishings and dull lighting gave it no atmosphere. We waited 10 minutes to be asked whether we would like coffee or tea. That day, after spending 6 hours in 32 degree heat walking the streets of Rome taking in the sights, we headed back to our so-called 5 star hotel only to find that the room was in the state we had left it at 8am. My wife first called reception, except no one picked up the phone, so then walked out to find the housekeeper standing in the hall. She asked why the room wasn't made up, only to be told that we didn't have our sign on the door (mind you, there was no sign to hang there). My wife (who is a travel agent and booked this hotel!) proceeded to vent some steam at the Conciege, again only to be passed down the line to Reception. We then had to wait half an hour for our room to be serviced. We waited in the lobby where no one informed us that our room was ready. We eventually got back to our room and again, to the hotel's credit, they brought us a botttle of wine and note from the General Manager with his apologies. Upon check-out, not one staf member asked us how our stay was. Fortunately, our 6 cent phone bill was scrapped. Ultimately, it is a shame that the hotel rests on its laurels and has become a most medicore 1 star establishment. It was disappointing that our last two nights of our honeymoon were somewhat of a let down. The other beautiful hotels in which we stayed in Europe we could not recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Wander5
Reviews.Content: First of all, in answer to the previous review, there most definitely was excellent high speed internet in the room. Beyond that: it's not really what I'd call a 5 star hotel. Processed, tasteless orange juice at breakfast, shockingly small room and bathroom, all very clean and nice enough but decorated in a fussy brocade-and-fleur-de-lys style that to me is more oppressive than luxurious. For this much money I am sure something much more special can be found in Rome. And the Via Veneto is not the most atmospheric of locations, though it's within walking distance of many awesome things.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel 1 star”
Reviews.Author: Gwendelen
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I don't mind paying top dollar for a 5 star hotel, but this hotel is a dump with rude staff. 1. old, old rooms with torn worn drapes, carpets and bedding 2. old disgusting bathroom 3. antiquated electrical system 4. NO INTERNET SERVICE - they will tell you they have it, they are lying 5. no conciere service 6. indifferent staff with no concern toward their guests 7. Very LOUD, we were unable to sleep due to motorcylces roaring up the street and excellerating in front of the hotel all night long. 8. Construction work right outside hotel with street dug up.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Clean Area”
Reviews.Author: Love2TrvlMM
Reviews.Content: Very nice location in Rome...Embassy row. The staff here was especially attentive to our every whim. We stayed 4 nights here and walked all of Roma from Villa Boeghese & Spanish Steps just minutes away, then south to St Paul's Basilica. You can do it! We had a very nice room here. The Roof top Bar and Breakfast area very nice location to start and end your day. We always had an evening drink looking out over Tome of the Unknown Soldier and the Vatican with a sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great but watch the poo”
Reviews.Author: londontravellista
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with gorgeous common areas. To reach our room, we had to take a set of stairs from the reception area, then a door, hallway and another set of stairs, we almost thought were on a different building. However the room was very large, almost a suite, but with views on a small street. Good base for visiting Rome, and one day after returning from our shopping we still saw the porter/security guy looking at a dog poo left since the morning. That would not happen in London. The hotel is located opposite the American embassy so if you go down the road you will reach an area with lots of nice restaurants. If you dare to book the restaurant up the road on the left (on the top floor of this hotel - have forgottent the name, but very famous), be warned, there is a waiter (the one that keeps his hands in the air when serving like he is in a duel) will let you wait for your change (some 50 euros tip for him). We couldn't be bothered to argue, since the view from the restaurant was so good. A little bit disappointed with the Italians, loud and shouting/rude even when asked questions in Italian. The airport is funny when you leave, so if up to no trouble always travel with British Airways.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience - No where near 5 star”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLindsay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I also recently had a bad experience at the Regina Baglioni in Rome during our honeymoon. Despite temperatures near 90 degrees Farenheit, we did not have air conditoning during our entire stay. We mentioned this to the staff several times, and asked for a solution, but one was never achieved. Thus, we endured several extremely warm nights, slept little, and were exhausted during our very expensive tours of Rome. Additonally, our bathroom had a terrible stench of raw sewage that was so bad we tried to avoid using it. The breakfast buffet in the morning was presented well, however the food was not fresh, and even still frozen at times. The staff seemed to have little care of whether or not our stay was satisfactory. When we mentioned our unsatisfaction with the air conditoning, the staff even had the nerve to defend the hotel, as if it was OUR fault that we demanded air conditoning. We could have stayed at a three star hotel, and had the basic ammenity of air conditoning. Oftentimes, we tried to avoid going home to our very expensive room because of the awful smell and high temperatures. Overall, our stay was beyond dissapointing, and even left a bad taste in our mouth of Rome. We stayed at several other 5-star hotels during our stay in Europe, and have only compliments for these establishments. I would not stay at another Baglioni hotel and would not recommend them under any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a revamp!”
Reviews.Author: UKNick74
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a stay in Rome at the Hotel Baglioni (Regina). We expected a 5 star hotel given the hotel's official rating and the room rate we paid. In our view this is NOT a 5 star hotel but rather a 4 star hotel with a lot to do to live up to its reputation. On arrival we were left to queue for some time as only one member of staff was at the reception desk. We were told that our room wasn't yet ready - fair enough, but we weren't told when it would be ready. On getting the room we were astonished at how dated the place was. Small room, next to a huge air conditioning facility outside. There was a flood (these things happen and the hotel managhed it well). No working air conditioning in the room throughout the stay and we heard others complaining about this in the inevitable check out queue. English TV channels were advertised (BBC etc) but only CNN was available. Wi-ff connection didn't work. The staff are inept, seemingly unbothered and generally don't really make the effort that other 5 star htoels I have stayed at put in. The mini bar was left to run dry - it's usually the norm at a 5 star hotel to at least get some bottled water daily (usually complimentary) but we had to ask (and pay!). The rooms we got a glimpse of are in need of a major refurbishment. This was an expensive 5 star hotel. Having stayed at a number of 5 star hotels I was hugely disappointed and didn't fell that I got value for money or a 5 star service. Certainly won't be going back and wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “"A Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: AlfieUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend for a romantic weekend to Rome. After taking advice from the local travel agent we decided on the Regina Baglioni hotel. On arrival at the hotel we were impressed by the grand staircase and fine decor of the hotel. Even though the hotel was busy re-launching their restaurant we were still given 100% customer service throughout our stay by the hotel staff. Our room faced the US Embassy, it was spacious and comfortable with a large bathroom and two balconies overlooking the Via Veneto in the heart of Rome. The next morning we had a lovely buffet style breakfast in the restaurant followed by a full days sight-seeing of all the major attractions of Rome. We would thoroughly recommend the Regina Baglioni hotel for its customer service, location, and its overall grandness.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, Great location”
Reviews.Author: O'Brigg
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near the center of the historical city. The hotel is very confortable, the rooms are large by European standards and the staff very friendly. A great place for business or leisure travellers in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: FromNYto?
Reviews.Content: From the lovely facade to the cushy bar area to the art deco room we stayed in-this hotel was a perfect way to wrap up a trip. We spent the last two nights of our honeymoon here and the manager sent us a bottle of proseco. The conceriege was happy to make dinner reservations for us and even arrange a car to the airport so we could make an early plane. It is nicely located --a good stroll too all the major sites. You got the energy of the city and the Spanish Steps area without the mobs. A real gem with old school elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Naora
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 8.55am and had a complimentary early check-in. Stayed in a Deluxe Room facing the American Embassy. The room is not as big as I thought but had a rather big bathroom. The taxi fares are between Euro 60-70 from the Airport to the Hotel. The breakfast was included in the room rate and nothing great to shout about. They served ham, 3 choices of hot dishes (mushroom, eggs and tomatoes, 3 selection of cheese, 3 selections of cereals, pastries, yogurts and fruits. Service was not great as what I expected. Asked them to refill the milk for the cereal but the milk never came. There was no butter on the table. Asked but the butter never came too. The staff of the hotel was magnificent, very friendly and speaks good English. The location was great! 7 minutes walk to the train station (M). As soon as you get out from the Hotel, turn left to the metro station (Via Veneto). If you turn right, walk further down, you will see all the restaurants, Hard Rock Cafe, Piazza Barbarini is 10 minutes walk , The Spanish Steps, Galleria Borghese are all within walking distance. If you like shopping for branded stuff, you should go to The Spanish Steps, you can see all brands there. Shops closes at 8pm. Try not to eat along Via Veneto as the food are not as nice and it is expensive too. An entrée, main meal and bottle of water can cost Euro37 per person. My overall stay was good. I will definitely come back to this hotel even though the breakfast was not great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: sjp1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baglioni for four nights and five days. I was impressed. The Hotel was at full capacity during my stay by virtue of a conference, however a guest would not have known other than the large groups of people coming and going. The service at the hotel was great during my entire stay. I did have a bad tuna fish sandwich which gave me horrible stomach pains(nicely put). That is the only bad thing I can say about the hotel. The rooms were very, very nice. I am very picky about cleanliness in hotels, and this hotel was very clean. The hotel is in a great location. I would highly recomned the Baglioni and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel with Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: PacificHeights7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a ten-night stay in Rome at the Regina Baglioni. The hotel, the location, and the staff of the hotel are all magnificent. Our room was huge with high ceilings, a separate dressing room, and a bathroom with two lavatories. Our room overlooked tree lined Via Veneto. The hotel is old world charm and elegance, as is the friendly, helpful, English speaking staff. There is a taxi stand across the street. The Spanish Steps, Galleria Borghese, and Piazza Barbarini are all within walking distance. Regina Baglioni is my first choice in hotels in Rome. The other guests were well-heeled and it is a nice haven for travelers who prefer not to be around families traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “lovely but too expensive,and staff a bit snooty”
Reviews.Author: tollumgrange
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for two nights in october 06, i did love that the hotel was like a beautifully preserved old mansion house, spotless beds, unusally large bathroom, walkin distance to all acttractions i disliked paying £710 ! pounds sterling [$1,350 USD or 1,050 euros] for two nights, in a tiny room on the very noisy second floor (traffic all night). being seated for breakfast by one member of staff then rudely being asked to move to another table in a hallway between the two dining rooms (maybe for someone paying an even higher rate than me?)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Squidgy1
Reviews.Content: We had 7 rooms booked here for 4 nights for a wedding party in August. all the rooms looked fine, the staff were extremely pleasant and courteous, especially the maids- despite the fact they didint have much english and I dont have a whole lot of Italian. We had to wait 2 hours to finally check in at 2pm but aside from that we (13 people) all enjoyed the breakfast, plenty of choice and everything was fresh. Nobody complained about anything (surely a miracle with a wedding party!)
