The bar was closed for renovations when we were there but a suite on the top floor had been converted to a bar and the views from there were breathtaking. The head barman was the best we'd all ever encountered and thats saying a lot as we were all Irish and if there's one thing we Irish know about its bars!, Wish I could remember his name but he was extremely courteous, welcoming and informative. This is an expensive hotel but its in a great location, our rooms were pretty and big and the staff are the biggest asset this place has.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: mthompson590
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to post a positive comment about this hotel and its staff. We are currently staying at the hotel and have been very impressed with the level of personal service and ambiance of the hotel and its rooms. The staff has gone out of their way to make our stay comfortable and resolve any problem we may have. This evening we accidently plugged in our digital camera's charger, which I didn't realize only worked at 110v, causing the power in our room to fail. The staff quickly and without complaint found the problem and fixed it. We are a family of three that had intended to share one room but as they had space available they provided us a second room for our daughter. The concierge has been very helpful in answering our numerous questions and accomodating our needs. The breakfast is delicious, the common areas beautiful, and the location great. We couldn't be more pleased and just wanted to share our experience with others as this site helped us find this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Regina Baglioni for six nights and could not have been more satisfied with the location, our room and the friendliness of the staff. The extensive buffet breakfasts were a great start to the day and the dining staff were most attentive and pleasant - happily serving us with bottomless pots of fresh Italian coffee. Having travelled extensively in Europe on four previous occasions we were well prepared for occasional disappointments, but everything at this hotel was delightful. We recommend it absolutely for couples who wish to spend their days and evenings seeing all that this wonderful city has to offer - before returning to the comfort of a top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly and wonderful staff at the Regina Baglioni in Via Veneto, Rome. We stayed there for five days at the end of December and had a grand time. We had a lovely room overlooking Via Veneto, good service. Delicious buffet breakfasts in the morning. The hotel is centrally located, quick stroll to Piazza di Spagna and main shopping areas. Concierge was helpful and gave us good recommendations, got us tickets for the Villa Borghese museum, sometimes hard to find. Great experience, would recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Regina”
Reviews.Author: Misha0603
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my husband at the Regina Baglioni for 3 nights on the 3rd January and I never had such a great experience in a 5 star hotel. We arrived very late at night after a delayed terrible flight from London and we received the warmest welcome ever. The hotel staff had checked with the airline our scheduled time of arrival and after discovering that the flight was delayed they left for us a delicious warm dinner in our room. The following morning the general manager welcomed us in the breakfast room, he was aware of our delayed flight of the previous night and gave us recommendation on places to visit and real roman restaurant in town... by the way we strongly suggest a dinner in the Testaccio district; it is much more typical than Trastevere and you may really meet people from Rome rather than tourists. We also had dinner the following night at the hotel Restaurant. Very elegant atmosphere and outstanding food. The hotel is very upscale but what made our stay different was the way we were treated by the whole staff as we really felt like being friends rather than clients. We will surely go back to the Regina and recommend it to all travellers wanting to stay in a "special" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JudyLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, nicely decorated, employees were polite and spoke English, good location, close to Spanish Steps and across the street from Borhgese Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travllgrl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Regina Baglioni. The best thing about the hotel was the location on Via Veneto. There are tons of places to eat within walking distance (although they are somewhat pricey - but most things are in Rome!), including many Italian restuarants, coffee shops, and a Hard Rock Cafe if you need a hamburger. It is also very easy to walk to major sight-seeing in the area from the hotel, including the Roman Forum and Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Villa Borghese Park and Museums in the park. My husband and I also got ambitious and decided to walk to St. Peter's Bascilica from the hotel. It was a good hike but it can be done - and it helps work off all the pasta and gelato you will be eating! Although the hotel is rated 4 (or 5...I can't remember) stars, it is not what I expect from an American hotel rated that high, but I think that is pretty standard. It did not have a workout room or pool, although if you like to walk or run just head to the Villa Borghese Park at the end of Via Veneto for good walking/running paths. It also does not have Internet access in all the rooms. Apparently if you stay in one of the suites, you might have it but in the regular rooms it was not available, or at least that is what we were told. There is a business center in the basement where you can use the Internet for 30 minutes free of charge. After 30 minutes you are charged a fee. Didn't try the restaurant or rooms service because it was quite expensive - great restaurants are just a step away so I wouldn't bother with room service anyway... The room itself was nice - had a queen bed with 2 chairs and a small table at the end of it. Also had a flat screen TV and plenty of closet/drawer space. Bathroom also had 2 sinks with marble countertops and separate shower/toilet area. Maid service was very good - everything was kept very clean and they came twice a day to put out new towels and straighten, turndown service, etc. The room also had air conditioning which was nice since it was quite hot while we were there. The Concierge staff was also very friendly and helpful. They set up several tours for us and also made reservations at the Villa Borghese Museum for us. The only bad thing I will say is that Via Veneto is a busy street and it was pretty loud - lots of honking going on outside all the time. They were also doing street construction while we were there and we heard drilling, etc early in the morning. Also, it would have been nice to have Internet, workout room, pool, but overall this was a clean hotel in a great location and if I went back to Rome, I would stay there again. There are several other hotels in the same area though (Excelsior Westin, a Marriott, and a few others) that I think did have pools, Internet so if those things are must haves, you might check on those prices also. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRSMDO
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay at the Baglioni Regina in Rome. I had a large room with a balcony on the Via Veneto. The room was immaculate and furnished beautifully. The service was impecable and the breakfast (wich was included in the room rate) was satisfactory. It was within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. During my stay they replaced the old TV with a new plasma screen TV. The hotel was a bit overpriced but I didn't find too many things in Italy that weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Not five stars experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baglioni, and compared to all of the other major cities in the world I've stayed in, I have to say I felt the value of the cost of this hotel was most definitely not worth it. I did find the location convenient, it was clean and the lobby area was nice. That is the extent of anything good I have to say. I sure we received the worst room in the hotel, at least I assume this from the reviews that liked this place. Bathroom was nice but very small and the room was very very small with worn fornitures. Sure not a five stars room, mostly between three and four stars. The staff did their job but no more than that. Next time I'll find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I've stayed in hotels around the world and have to say that I expected more out of the Regina Hotel Baglioni. For starters, the rooms can be quite small. I arrived not knowing what to expect, as my company generally books all travel and accommodations: my room was barely large enough to allow a person to walk around the bed. A table and chair were placed in front of the bed, though I really would've preferred not having them there and having a few extra feet of space to move around in. I was originally in one of the few rooms with an accessible balcony and a view of the main street (Via Veneto), yet was unable to find a high-speed internet jack in the room, despite having been told that my room would have one. I requested a move after having the concierge confirm that the room did not have internet, only to be moved to a room that was even smaller, with neither a balcony nor a view, and still no internet. Though the technician who came to my room to find the internet jack was very apologetic for the mistake and seemed to sympathize with my having had to unnecessarily unpack and then re-pack all of my things for no reason, I remain disappointed. Several of my coworkers (all paying the same room rate, mind you) have rooms that would be considered palatial in comparison, WITH internet, no less. Inexplicably, some ~400E/night rooms are larger and nicer than others, and the maids seem to acknowledge this by leaving chocolates for some, while merely offering turndown service to others. Bathrooms are also inconsistent, as some offer bathtubs and separate vanity areas while others (mine) do not. Another point worth mentioning is that the bathrooms are curiously lacking any ventilation, an oversight which for the past week has allowed me the pleasure of waking up to the oh-so-pleasant smell of mold-- that is, when I'm not too congested from having inhaled the ridiculous amounts of pollen and other allergens that manage to make their way into my room at night, past what I suspect to be a filterless HVAC unit. Mosquitoes, too, manage to find their way into the rooms. I've had good experiences at breakfast thus far, though my coworkers complain that the eggs are runny and certain breakfast cereals are offered only on certain days of the week; if bread/rolls and jelly/nutella/cold cuts are more your thing, you'll be satisfied. The concierge, however, as well as all staff I've dealt with so far, are incredibly friendly and accomodating. I'm certain they would've moved me into another room if I'd asked, though I honestly didn't feel it to be worth the trouble. They are quick to offer dining recommendations, as well as provide assistance with taxis, reservations, etc. The location of the hotel is also very convenient to almost everything worth seeing in Rome. All in all, despite the hotel drawbacks, any stay in Rome is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough”
Reviews.Author: tmcg301
Reviews.Content: As a single woman in her 30's traveling to Rome for the first time, my criteria for a hotel were pretty straight forward: clean and comfortable, safe, and in a good neighborhood reasonably close to the sights to see in the city. I hoped the Hotel Regina Baglioni would fit the bill and I was not disappointed. Yes, it was not the most affordable option out there, but I was willing to spend a little extra to ensure a good experience. I was able to walk just about anywhere I wanted to go, and the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Villa Borghese are all quite close. The Piazza Barberini area was also a fun area at night and I felt safe walking around. The room was small, but probably typical for a single in Europe. I did feel breakfast in the hotel was overpriced, and I skipped it. The staff were friendly and helpful. My only real complaints were that twice during my stay a strange smell filtered into my room and that the hot water in the bathroom sink made a real racket everytime I turned it on. But these were minor inconveniences in anotherwise satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but surely not worth 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: BettyCad
Reviews.Content: The Regina Baglioni isn't bad but shouldn't really be a 5 star. The room was small but clean and had a view of the next door's rubbish bins (which were noisily emptied every morning at 7am). The staff are all friendly and helpful but they allow taxi touts to hang around outside the entrance and bother guests. Watch out in case they try to pack you off in a "mate's" car back to the airport when you ask for a taxi - it's cheaper on the meter. A strange practice for a 5 star hotel I thought!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great value....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this weekend and the hotel was fine is every respect - they had a very good concierge service. But the room itself was unremarkable, and a little dated. As a frequent traveler I have stayed in three star hotels that were of similar quality. It is worth noting that the hotel is about a 15 minute uphill walk from the Spanish Steps (yes up the steps! if you're not mobile you can take the elevator or you walk around), located with a number of other 5 star hotels (Hotel Majestic etc). All in all it was a perfectly good hotel, but not excellent. I would choose the Majestic or Hotel Eden as a luxury choice, or a three star for better value.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a weekend spent at the Regina and have to say were a little disappointed. Like the other reviewer we also had hot water problems, i.e. there was none! And after a day walking around in the cold a nice warm bath would have been very welcoming, however on both nights it was tepid. We did complain and was told that there was a problem throughout the hotel and it would take hours to fix!, not what you would expect for a 5* hotel. Apart from that one problem, overall the hotel was nice. The best point is definitely its location, you can walk to all the main tourist attractions. Would definately go back to Rome, but i wouldn't stay at the Regina again.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could say the same”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say the same about the hotel but... We have spent 3 nights in the hotel in Feb '05 and overall experience was OK, however we have booked a deluxe room which for some reason same price as classic , however we've been given classic (without telling us) which was on the 7th floor with an awful view (actually no view at all) and two out of three nights we had a problem with hot water. The staff was trying to be helpful and tried to move us to a better room (that's how I found out that we've been given classic instead of deluxe room (deluxe = bigger, double basin, view …)), but apparently hot water in this hotel actually warm in the evening (you can hardly take a shower, don't even think about having a bath. To be fair I was pleasantly surprised when they charged us only half of the total price, but probably that's how 5*L hotel should behave. If you ask me I wouldn’t saty there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Regina Baglioni
HotelInfo.Address: Via V. Veneto 72 | Lazio, 00187 Rome, Italy
